translation: 你拿出笔记，看向嫌疑人列表。

original: You might be at this for a while.[p/] So you might as well go in order.
translation: 这要花上一些时间。[p/]最好按顺序来试。

original: You clear your throat in preparation.
translation: 你清了清嗓子。

original: Tyrion: Empress of Discord![p/][s/] Wherever you may hide!
translation: Tyrion: 无序女皇！[p/][s/]不管你藏身何处！

original: Tyrion: Release thy guards and manifest your Blood Contract with Aster de Wyverngarde!
translation: Tyrion: 放下防备，展示你和阿斯特·维文加德的血契！

original: Tyrion: AGGGGGGGGGH!
translation: Tyrion: <size=1.5em>啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊！</size>

original: Celeste: ...Tyrion?![p/][s/] What's wrong?!
translation: Celeste: ……提利昂？！[p/][s/]你怎么了？！

original: You collapse to the ground as you suddenly find yourself overcome in immense pain.
translation: 你突然被强烈的痛苦包围，瘫倒在地。

original: Miriam: W-[p/][s/]What...?!
translation: Miriam: 什、[p/][s/]什么……？！

original: Miriam: What's happening to him?!
translation: Miriam: 他出什么事了？！

original: Liafal: Lazarick![p/][s/] Use your magic to heal him!
translation: Liafal: 拉扎瑞克！[p/][s/]用你的魔法治疗他！

original: Lazarick: R-[p/][s/]Right!
translation: Lazarick: 好、[p/][s/]好的！

original: Eris: Oh, you silly, silly boy.
translation: Eris: 哎哟，你这个小笨蛋。

original: Eris: You may be half-human.[p/] But you can't just go around declaring [i]lies[/i] like that.
translation: Eris: 虽然是个半人类，但你也不能随便宣告<u>谎言</u>。

original: Tyrion: ...What?
translation: Tyrion: ……什么？

original: Eris: *sigh*[p/] And I was [i]really[/i] looking forward to bringing you to the end of this.
translation: Eris: *叹气* [p/]我本来还<u>挺期待</u>让你走向末路。

original: Eris: I haven't even [i]started[/i] to have my fun yet.
translation: Eris: 好戏<u>还没开始</u>呢。

original: Tyrion: Who...[p/] Who are you?
translation: Tyrion: 你……[p/]你是谁？

original: Eris: Actually...[p/] I suppose [i]that[/i] contract is still in effect.
translation: Eris: 其实……[p/]我猜<u>那份</u>契约还有效。

original: Eris: I guess my hands are tied.[p/] I'll save you,[p/] just this once.
translation: Eris: 看来我无法不从。[p/]只有这次，[p/]我会救你。

original: Celeste: ...rion...
translation: Celeste: ……利昂……

original: Celeste: Tyrion![p/][s/] Please, wake up!
translation: Celeste: 提利昂！[p/][s/]求你了，快醒来！

original: Tyrion: ...Celeste?
translation: Tyrion: ……塞莱斯特？

original: Celeste: Y-[p/][s/]You're okay!
translation: Celeste: 你、[p/][s/]你没事！

original: You most certainly don't [i]feel[/i] "okay".
translation: 你完全<u>不觉得</u>自己“没事”。

original: You can feel every part of your body aching.
translation: 你全身上下每一处都在隐隐作痛。

original: It's painful for you to even sit up like this.
translation: 就连这么做起来都使你痛苦不堪。

original: Tracker: Are you okay, friend?
translation: Tracker: 你没事吧，朋友？

original: Tyrion: Y-[p/][s/]Yeah...
translation: Tyrion: 嗯、[p/][s/]嗯……

original: Tyrion: What...[p/] happened?
translation: Tyrion: 怎么……[p/]回事？

original: Lazarick: ...
translation: Lazarick: ……

original: Lazarick: You died.
translation: Lazarick: 你死了。

original: Tyrion: W-[p/][s/]What?!
translation: Tyrion: 什、[p/][s/]什么？

original: Lazarick: I've never brought anyone back from something like that.
translation: Lazarick: 我从没成功救过陷入那种危机的人。

original: Lazarick: That was my strongest spell too.[p/] You have no idea how lucky you are.
translation: Lazarick: 我用的也是自己最强力的法术。[p/]你都不知道自己有多幸运。

original: Lazarick: If [i]I[/i] wasn't here,[p/] who knows what might've happened...
translation: Lazarick: 如果<u>我</u>不在，[p/]谁知道会怎么样……

original: Tyrion: I don't understand...
translation: Tyrion: 我不明白……

original: Tyrion: The last thing I remember was issuing my Divine Edict...
translation: Tyrion: 我能想起来的最后一件事就是发出神谕……

original: Tyrion: Wait...
translation: Tyrion: 等等……

original: Liafal: Was [i]that[/i] the cause?
translation: Liafal: <u>那</u>就是原因？

original: Tyrion: But I've done it before without any problems.[p/] I [i]just[/i] used it this morning.
translation: Tyrion: 但我以前发出神谕时没有问题啊。[p/]我今早还<u>刚刚</u>用过。

original: No...[p/] That pain came [i]after[/i] you attempted to issue a Divine Edict.
translation: 不……[p/]痛苦是在你尝试发出神谕<u>之后</u>产生的。

original: You started at the top of your list of suspects.[p/]
translation: 你从嫌疑人列表最上方试起。

original: Which means you tried to manifest the Blood Contract between the Empress of Discord and Aster.
translation: 也就是说你尝试展示无序女皇与阿斯特的血契。

original: Tyrion: ...It [i]might[/i] be because Aster [i]doesn't[/i] have a Blood Contract with the Empress.
translation: Tyrion: ……<u>也许</u>是因为阿斯特与女皇<u>没有</u>签约血契。

original: Tyrion: If demons are unable to lie,[p/] the same might hold true for angels as well.
translation: Tyrion: 如果恶魔不能说谎，[p/]天使可能也受到同样的规则限制。

original: Tyrion: The Divine Edict is clearly some sort of divine magic.
translation: Tyrion: 神谕很明显是某种神圣魔法。

original: Tyrion: So asking for a Blood Contract that doesn't exist might be considered a lie.
translation: Tyrion: 要求展示不存在的血契可能会被判断为说谎。

original: Lazarick: S-[p/][s/]Sorry...[p/] It's my fault for suggesting it.
translation: Lazarick: 抱、[p/][s/]抱歉……[p/]我不该这么建议的。

original: Tyrion: No...[p/] I was being reckless.
translation: Tyrion: 没有……[p/]是我太鲁莽了。

original: Celeste: Please be more careful...
translation: Celeste: 求你小心点……

original: Celeste: I don't think my heart can take this.
translation: Celeste: 我的心脏承受不了。

original: Tyrion: Well...[p/] At least we know [i]Aster[/i] wasn't behind this...
translation: Tyrion: 哎……[p/]至少我们知道了幕后黑手不是<u>阿斯特</u>……

original: Celeste: He was the most obvious one!
translation: Celeste: 最不可能的就是他啊！

original: Either way,[p/] you should still make note of this.
translation: 不管怎样，[p/]你还是应该把这一点记下来。

original: Tyrion: Ugh...[p/] Anyways,[p/] it's clear that I can't just issue these edicts without thinking.
translation: Tyrion: 呜呃……[p/]总之，[p/]我不能不过大脑就随便发出神谕。

original: Tyrion: I'll just have to wait until I'm certain of the Patron's identity.
translation: Tyrion: 必须等到我确认签约人身份之后才行。

original: Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Celeste: ...Just please be careful.
translation: Celeste: ……我只求你小心。

original: Anyways,[p/] it looks like you've found everything you can here.
translation: 总之，[p/]你应该已经找全所有有用的线索了。

original: Perhaps you should MOVE somewhere else.
translation: 你应该<size=1.5em>移动</size>到其他地方。

original: Tyrion: What goes through the mind of such a tortured creature?
translation: Tyrion: 这受尽折磨的生物平常会思考什么呢？

original: Celeste: ...What is with you and this statue?
translation: Celeste: ……你跟这雕像认识？

original: Tyrion: I don't know...[p/] But I can feel its emotions as if they were my own.
translation: Tyrion: 不认识……[p/]但我能感知到他的情绪。

original: Celeste: It's an inanimate object, Tyrion!
translation: Celeste: 提利昂，这都不是个生物！

original: Aster: You said that you two were investigating the murders.
translation: Aster: 你说你们两个在调查这些谋杀案。

original: Aster: You weren't planning to defend Ms. Steelwind, were you?
translation: Aster: 你们是打算为斯蒂尔文德女士辩护吗？

original: Tyrion: If she would have me.
translation: Tyrion: 如果她允许。

original: Tyrion: She may be a competent prosecutor.[p/] But I have far more experience defending clients.
translation: Tyrion: 她作为检察官实力强悍，[p/]但辩护这方面我更有经验。

original: Aster: Unfortunately,[p/] I think the situation is more complicated than that.
translation: Aster: 不幸的是，[p/]我认为现况要更加复杂。

original: Tyrion: What do you mean?
translation: Tyrion: 你是什么意思？

original: Aster: Several House leaders died today.
translation: Aster: 今天多位家族领主死了。

original: Aster: We can't release this information to the public.
translation: Aster: 我们不能把这些信息公之于众。

original: Aster: Not after the news of William Frega's death has already spread.
translation: Aster: 至少不是在威廉·弗雷加之死已经传开的情况下。

original: Aster: In the course of two months,[p/] we've lost not one,[p/] but [i]three[/i] members of the Pillar Families.
translation: Aster: 两个月的时间里，[p/]我们失去了整整<u>三位</u>四大支柱家族的领主。

original: Tyrion: But the trial [i]has[/i] to happen soon.[p/] Or else the magical traces left will disappear.
translation: Tyrion: 但审理<u>必须</u>马上开始。不然魔法痕迹会消失的。

original: Aster: From what I've heard,[p/] we [i]will[/i] be holding a trial.
translation: Aster: 就我所知，[p/]审理是<u>会</u>举行的。

original: Aster: But it will be handled privately and internally.
translation: Aster: 但将是私下在内部举行。

original: Aster: ...And I'm sorry to say that,[p/] you won't be permitted to serve in such a trial.
translation: Aster: ……很抱歉这么说，[p/]但你不会被允许参加这种审理。

original: Tyrion: Right...[p/] A majority of the nobility hates me after all...
translation: Tyrion: 确实……[p/]毕竟恨我的贵族已经有一大把了……

original: Tyrion: ...You wouldn't be able to pull some strings, would you Aster?
translation: Tyrion: ……阿斯特你能不能帮我想想办法？

original: Aster: I-[p/][s/] I'm sorry.[p/] I'd like nothing more than to give you the opportunity to represent her.
translation: Aster: 我、[p/][s/]我很抱歉。[p/]我也很想给你机会为她辩护。

original: Aster: But I clearly have a personal attachment to this case.
translation: Aster: 但我显然与这案子利益相关。

original: Aster: If I try to tip the trial in her favour,[p/] it will only harm her chances more.
translation: Aster: 即使我尝试让审理对她有利，[p/]也只会帮倒忙。

original: Tyrion: Right...[p/] I see what you mean.
translation: Tyrion: 也是……[p/]我明白你的意思。

original: Tyrion: But even if we can't help her during the trial,[p/] we can still investigate the crimes on her behalf.
translation: Tyrion: 但即使不能在审理期间帮助她，[p/]我们也还是可以代表她调查案件。

original: Aster: ...Yes.[p/] I would really appreciate that.
translation: Aster: ……对。[p/]我很感激。

original: Aster: If new evidence is found,[p/] perhaps we can exonerate Ms. Steelwind of the charges against her.
translation: Aster: 如果找到了新证据，[p/]也许我们能为斯蒂尔文德女士沉冤昭雪。

original: Tyrion: After everything that's happened,[p/] I really need to know.
translation: Tyrion: 发生这么多以后，[p/]我很想知道一件事。

original: Tyrion: Why were so many nobles gathered in one place anyways?
translation: Tyrion: 为什么会有那么多贵族聚在一起？

original: Tyrion: All four of the pillar families were present.
translation: Tyrion: 四大支柱家族的成员都有出席。

original: Aster: ...
translation: Aster: ……

original: Tyrion: I understand if you don't want to tell me.
translation: Tyrion: 如果你不想说我也理解。

original: Tyrion: But this information could be vital in figuring out what really happened.
translation: Tyrion: 但这也许会是找出真相的关键线索。

original: Aster: ...No.[p/] I see your point.
translation: Aster: ……没事。[p/]我理解。

original: Aster: ...The truth is we all gathered to mourn the death of my father:[p/] King Olivier de Wyverngarde IX.
translation: Aster: ……我们聚在那里是为了悼念我的父亲，先王奥利维尔·维文加德九世。

original: Tyrion: Wait...[p/][s/] The king is [i]dead[/i]?!
translation: Tyrion: 等等……[p/][s/]国王<u>死了</u>？！

original: Aster: Yes.[p/] We wanted to avoid releasing this information to the public so close to the death of William Frega.
translation: Aster: 是的。[p/]威廉·弗雷加的死刚发生不久，我们不想立刻公布这一消息。

original: Aster: My father has been ill for quite some time.[p/] So we were prepared for this.
translation: Aster: 我的父亲已经抱病在床很长时间。[p/]所以我们也有心理准备。

original: Aster: ...Or at least,[p/] I [i]thought[/i] I was.
translation: Aster: ……或者说，[p/]我<u>以为</u>自己有。

original: Aster: I also lost my mother when I was quite young...
translation: Aster: 我很小的时候就失去了母亲……

original: Aster: But it's still all a little hard to take in.
translation: Aster: 但失去亲人还是会让人难受。

original: Tyrion: I'm sorry...[p/] You have my condolences.
translation: Tyrion: 我很遗憾……[p/]请节哀顺变。

original: Aster: Thank you.
translation: Aster: 谢谢你。

original: Celeste: But if King Olivier is dead...[p/] That would make you-
translation: Celeste: 但如果奥利维尔王死了……[p/]那你就会是——

original: Aster: Yes.[p/] You currently stand before [i]King[/i] Aster de Wyverngarde:[p/] ruler of our kingdom.
translation: Aster: 是的。[p/]你面前的是阿斯特·维文加德<u>国王</u>，我国的新统治者。

original: Considering everything that's happened,[p/] he seems less than thrilled about that.
translation: 考虑到发生了什么，[p/]他似乎对此并不激动。

original: Tyrion: I suppose that explains why all of these nobles were gathered.
translation: Tyrion: 我想这就是贵族齐聚一堂的原因。

original: Aster: *sigh*[p/] They came under the guise of paying their respects.
translation: Aster: *叹气*[p/]他们装作是为了悼念先王前来。

original: Aster: But it's clear they all wanted to get closer to the [i]new[/i] King of Wyverngarde.
translation: Aster: 但他们的目的明显是为了接近<u>新任</u>维文加德国王。

original: Aster: I think the Fregas were the only ones who genuinely came to give their condolences.
translation: Aster: 弗雷加一族是唯一真心为悼念而来的人。

original: Tyrion: Speaking of the Fregas...[p/] I think you need to know.
translation: Tyrion: 说到弗雷加一族……[p/]有一件事得告诉你。

original: Tyrion: I [i]saw[/i] Beatrice before I was knocked out.
translation: Tyrion: 我在昏过去之前<u>看见了</u>比亚特丽丝。

original: Tyrion: I think [i]she[/i] may have been the one that killed Garrick Pierce.
translation: Tyrion: 我认为<u>她</u>可能就是杀害加里克·皮尔斯的真凶。

original: Aster: ... [mind="Why would she be there?!"/]
translation: Aster: …… [mind="为什么她会在这儿？！"/]

original: Tyrion: I'm sorry.[p/] I know she's your friend.
translation: Tyrion: 很抱歉。[p/]我知道她是你的朋友。

original: Tyrion: ...But we already know she's not above committing murder.
translation: Tyrion: ……但我们也已经知道她有杀人的前科。

original: Aster: I-[p/][s/]I see.
translation: Aster: 我、[p/][s/]我明白了。

original: Aster: I suppose if [i]you're[/i] saying it,[p/] it must be so.
translation: Aster: 如果<u>你</u>都在这么说，那一定是真的。

original: Aster: ...But what possible reason would she have to be involved in something like this?
translation: Aster: ……可她有什么理由要参与这种事呢？

original: Tyrion: I'm not sure yet.[p/] But I plan to find that out.
translation: Tyrion: 我现在还不确定。[p/]但我会找出原因的。

original: Tyrion: By the way,[p/] where were [i]you[/i] during the murders?
translation: Tyrion: 顺便问一下，[p/]谋杀发生时<u>你</u>在哪里？

original: Tyrion: I remember you left with Steelwind when Celeste and I arrived at the Cathedral.
translation: Tyrion: 记得我和塞莱斯特抵达大教堂时，你和斯蒂尔文德一起离开了。

original: Aster: Ah, yes.[p/] Steelwind and I left to speak with High Speaker Archeus in his quarters.
translation: Aster: 啊，是的。[p/]斯蒂尔文德和我去了大主教阿契厄斯的住处和他谈话。

original: Tyrion: What was your meeting about?
translation: Tyrion: 你们谈的内容是？

original: Aster: ...It was actually about our wedding.
translation: Aster: ……是关于我们的婚礼。

original: Aster: With my father's death,[p/] Lord Steelwind wanted to finally make our union official.
translation: Aster: 我父亲已死，[p/]斯蒂尔文德勋爵希望让我们正式结为连理。

original: Tyrion: Oh...!
translation: Tyrion: 噢……！

original: Tyrion: I [i]would[/i] congratulate you two,[p/] but considering the circumstances-...
translation: Tyrion: 虽然我很想恭喜你们两个，[p/]但考虑到现况——

original: Aster: I understand.[p/] And I appreciate your words nonetheless.
translation: Aster: 我理解。[p/]我也很感谢你的祝福。

original: Tyrion: Anyways,[p/] how long did this meeting last?
translation: Tyrion: 总之，[p/]你们的面会持续了多久？

original: Aster: I believe we spoke with him until 1:40 PM.
translation: Aster: 我们和他一直谈到下午 1:40。

original: Tyrion: ...But von Sanctus died at 2:05 PM.
translation: Tyrion: ……但冯·桑克图斯的死亡时间是下午 2:05。

original: Tyrion: That means that she began her rampage less than half an hour after that meeting.
translation: Tyrion: 意味着她在会议结束之后半小时不到就开始了自己的狂暴行为。

original: Tyrion: Was there anything off about her behaviour?
translation: Tyrion: 她当时举止有什么奇怪的地方吗？

original: Aster: Now that you mention it,[p/] something about her demeanor changed.
translation: Aster: 你这么一提，[p/]她的行动确实有些古怪。

original: Aster: We were speaking of the wedding when she abruptly left.
translation: Aster: 她在我们谈论婚礼中途突然离场。

original: Aster: I asked her where she was going,[p/] but she ignored me.
translation: Aster: 我问她要去哪里，[p/]但被无视了。

original: Tyrion: ...That sounds similar to what happened when Celeste fought her.
translation: Tyrion: ……听起来和塞莱斯特与她搏斗时的样子大差不差。

original: Tyrion: There's no way she was affected by Mageblight...
translation: Tyrion: 她不可能感染法师之疫……

original: Aster: I honestly didn't think much of it at the time.
translation: Aster: 我当时没想那么多。

original: Aster: I'm quite used to her giving me the cold shoulder.
translation: Aster: 我已经习惯她对我冷眼相待了。

original: Celeste: ...Right.
translation: Celeste: ……是。

original: It's possible that the "Steelwind" the witnesses saw wasn't actually real.
translation: 目击者看到的“斯蒂尔文德”可能是个假货。

original: Does that mean the "Steelwind" that attended the meeting was [i]also[/i] a fake?
translation: 那参加面会的“斯蒂尔文德”会不会<u>也是</u>假的？

original: Tyrion: Anyways,[p/] what happened after your meeting with the High Speaker?
translation: Tyrion: 总之，[p/]你们与大主教的面会之后怎么了？

original: Tyrion: Did you see Steelwind after that?
translation: Tyrion: 你在那之后见过斯蒂尔文德吗？

original: Aster: Actually,[p/] [i]I[/i] found myself caught up in something else entirely.
translation: Aster: 事实上，[p/]<u>我</u>自己也遇到了大麻烦。

original: Aster: At 2:00 PM,[p/] I went to pay my respects at my father's coffin.
translation: Aster: 下午 2:00，[p/]我去父亲的遗棺那里悼念他。

original: Aster: But apparently,[p/] someone had set a magical trap there.
translation: Aster: 但那里被人设下了魔法陷阱。

original: Celeste: ...What?!
translation: Celeste: ……什么？！

original: Aster: It was a [b]Glyph of Contingency[/b].
translation: Aster: 是[b]有备无患[/b]法术。

original: Celeste: I have...[p/] heard of that spell.
translation: Celeste: 我……[p/]听说过这种法术。

original: Celeste: It's like a trap you can set.[p/] And you can infuse [i]any[/i] spell into it.
translation: Celeste: 你可以在这种法术里输入一个[b]任意[/b]法术，[p/]借此设下陷阱。

original: Tyrion: But it requires a second,[p/] "contingent" spell to [i]place[/i] that trap.
translation: Tyrion: 也就意味着陷阱里有一个以备不时之需的法术。

original: Tyrion: Which spell was it?
translation: Tyrion: 这个法术是？

original: Aster: It was a [b]Force Cage[/b]...[p/] targeting [i]me[/i].
translation: Aster: 是[b]坚牢术[/b]……专门针对[b]我[/b]的。

original: Celeste: ...Was the murderer trying to attack Aster too?
translation: Celeste: ……凶手也想攻击阿斯特吗？

original: Tyrion: I don't think so...[p/] They would have used a more lethal spell if they wanted to.
translation: Tyrion: 我不觉得……[p/]不然他们就会在陷阱里设下更为致命的法术了。

original: Tyrion: But from the sounds of it,[p/] [b]Force Cage[/b] can't be dispelled.
translation: Tyrion: 从描述看来，[p/][b]坚牢术[/b]无法被驱散。

original: Tyrion: So Aster would have been trapped inside of it for that full hour.
translation: Tyrion: 阿斯特在里面被关了整整一个小时。

original: Aster: We think the murderer used this as a distraction.
translation: Aster: 我们认为这是凶手的调虎离山之计。

original: Aster: Because of that trap,[p/] the Kingsguard consolidated most of their attention and forces on my location.
translation: Aster: 由于这个陷阱，[p/]国王卫队将大部分力量集中在了我的位置。

original: Aster: As a result,[p/] there were fewer people guarding von Sanctus, Sibyl, and Pierce.
translation: Aster: 结果就是，[p/]可以保卫冯·桑克图斯，希比尔和皮尔斯的人变少了。

original: Aster: And the ones that [i]were[/i] there all fell comatose.
translation: Aster: 能保卫他们的人最终也都陷入昏迷。

original: Aster: They can't tell us what happened to them.
translation: Aster: 也因此无法告诉我们发生了什么。

original: Aster: This whole situation is quite a mess.
translation: Aster: 整个局面都是一团乱。

original: Aster: I do consider myself lucky that [i]you're[/i] here, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: Aster: <u>你</u>在这里让我感到庆幸，卡斯伯特先生。

original: Tyrion: I appreciate your trust.[p/] But I still can't make sense of what I've found so far.
translation: Tyrion: 我对你的信任表示感激。[p/]但我目前还无法解读自己发现的线索背后有什么意义。

original: Aster: Well, if anyone can find out what happened,[p/] it's you.
translation: Aster: 哎，能找出真相的人只有你了。

original: Aster: I'm glad you were with Mr. Cuthbert when the assailant struck, Ms. McCoy.
translation: Aster: 我也很高兴袭击发生时你和卡斯伯特先生在一起，麦考伊女士。

original: Aster: Who knows what would have happened if you weren't there...
translation: Aster: 我都不敢想象如果你不在，事情会怎样发展……

original: Celeste: No...[p/] I failed completely.
translation: Celeste: 不……[p/]我彻头彻尾失败了。

original: Celeste: I let the murderer get past me.[p/] They could have [i]killed[/i] Tyrion.
translation: Celeste: 我让凶手逃离了我。[p/]提利昂当时有可能<u>被杀</u>。

original: Tyrion: You can't keep blaming yourself for what happened.
translation: Tyrion: 你不能把发生的事都怪在自己身上。

original: Tyrion: And we're both safe now.[p/] That's what matters.
translation: Tyrion: 重要的是我们现在都安全了。

original: Celeste: Yeah...
translation: Celeste: 是啊……

original: Aster: I can't believe Ms. Steelwind is being blamed for this.
translation: Aster: 我不敢相信他们会把这怪到斯蒂尔文德女士身上。

original: Aster: Although,[p/] I can't fault the Kingsguard for that.
translation: Aster: 虽然我也不能因此指责国王卫队。

original: Tyrion: Right...[p/] There were several witnesses who saw her.[p/]
translation: Tyrion: 是啊……[p/]好几名目击者看到了她。

original: Tyrion: And Celeste's testimony shows it wasn't someone [i]else[/i] magically disguised as her.
translation: Tyrion: 塞莱斯特的证言也表明，并不是<u>其他人</u>用魔法伪装成她的样子。

original: Aster: I hope she's doing okay.
translation: Aster: 我希望她没事。

original: Tyrion: Is [b]Glyph of Contingency[/b] common for mages to know?
translation: Tyrion: 会[b]有备无患[/b]的法师很多吗？

original: Aster: No.[p/] It's extremely useful.[p/] But it's also very advanced.
translation: Aster: 不。[p/]这法术很有用。[p/]但也十分高深。

original: Aster: It essentially involves casting two spells at the same time.
translation: Aster: 简单来说，施法者需要同时施展两个法术。

original: Tyrion: So whoever set that trap was a powerful mage...
translation: Tyrion: 所以设下陷阱的肯定是个强力法师……

original: Celeste: But considering the people who were here,[p/] [i]that[/i] hardly narrows it down.
translation: Celeste: 但考虑到在场的人，[p/][i]这一点[/i]也没法缩小范围。

original: Aster: Lloyd von Sanctus is actually dead...
translation: Aster: 洛伊德·冯·桑克图斯死了……

original: Aster: And I just saw him this morning too.
translation: Aster: 我今早才见过他。

original: Tyrion: Yeah...[p/] Despite my feelings about him,[p/] no one deserves to be killed in cold blood.
translation: Tyrion: 是啊……[p/]虽然我不喜欢他，[p/]但没人该被这样冷血谋杀。

original: Aster: If there's [i]some[/i] silver lining,[p/] it's that he can no longer harm people with his negligence.
translation: Aster: 要说有什么积极之处的话，[p/]就是他再也不能祸害民众了。

original: He must still be thinking about what happened to Justin Waye.
translation: 他大概还在想贾斯汀·维耶的事。

original: Aster: I can't believe someone killed Lady Sibyl.
translation: Aster: 不敢相信有人杀了希比尔小姐。

original: Tyrion: Did you know her well?
translation: Tyrion: 你很了解她？

original: Aster: Quite well.[p/] We had many debates about how her family ran the judicial system.
translation: Aster: 相当了解。[p/]就希比尔家如何运营司法系统这点，我们辩论过多次。

original: Aster: I found them quite...[p/] frustrating.
translation: Aster: 这些辩论都很……[p/]令人沮丧。

original: Tyrion: ...After speaking to her,[p/] I can kind of understand what you mean.
translation: Tyrion: ……和她交谈过后，[p/]我多少理解你的意思。

original: Tyrion: What do you think about this, Aster?
translation: Tyrion: 阿斯特，你怎么看？

original: Aster: My apologies, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] I don't have much to say about that.
translation: Aster: 很抱歉，卡斯伯特先生。[p/]我没有什么能说的。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: ...It's just you,[p/] Celeste,[p/] and the statue.[p/] The horrible statue.
translation: ……这里只有你，[p/]塞莱斯特，[p/]雕像。[p/]可怕的雕像。

original: Tyrion: ...I don't feel safe here.
translation: Tyrion: .……我觉得这里不安全。

original: Celeste: Why is that statue freaking you out so much?
translation: Celeste: 你怎么这么害怕一个雕像啊？

original: Celeste: That pegasus is [i]literally[/i] a celestial like you!
translation: Celeste: 这天马可是你的天界老乡！

original: Tyrion: I don't know.[p/] But I can feel its suffering through the Eye.
translation: Tyrion: 我不知道。[p/]但我能通过荷鲁斯之眼感受到它在承受痛苦。

original: Celeste: It's an [i]inanimate[/i] object, Tyrion!
translation: Celeste: 提利昂，这都不是个生物！

original: Tyrion: ...Let's MOVE somewhere else.
translation: Tyrion: ……我们<size=1.5em>移动</size>到其他地方吧。

original: Celeste: Alright.[p/] Whatever it takes to get you to stop acting so weird.
translation: Celeste: 好吧。[p/]只要能让你别这么举止可疑就行。

original: You arrive back at the cathedral's garden and come across that accursed statue again.
translation: 你们回到了大教堂的花园，又遇上了那受诅咒的雕像。

original: Tyrion: ...It's staring into my soul.
translation: Tyrion: ……这雕像盯得我肝颤。

original: Celeste: Then stop looking at it!
translation: Celeste: 那你不要看它了！

original: As you move your attention away from the grotesque sculpture,[p/] you spot the crown prince.
translation: 把视线从可怖的雕像上移开后，[p/]你看到了王储殿下。

original: He's sitting on a bench,[p/] guarded by some knights from the Kingsguard.
translation: 他正坐在长椅上，身边有数名国王卫队的骑士保卫。

original: His brow is furrowed,[p/] and he seems to be deep in thought.
translation: 他眉头紧皱，[p/]看起来陷入沉思。

original: Aster: O-[p/][s/]Oh, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] And Ms. McCoy too.
translation: Aster: 噢、[p/]噢，卡斯伯特先生。[p/]还有麦考伊女士。

original: Aster: What are you still doing here?
translation: Aster: 你们怎么还在这儿？

original: Tyrion: We're trying to investigate what happened.
translation: Tyrion: 我们在调查案件详情。

original: Tyrion: We were looking around when we just happened to find you here.
translation: Tyrion: 四处搜查的过程中恰好在这里遇到了你。

original: Aster: I see...
translation: Aster: 原来如此……

original: Aster: ...
translation: Aster: ……

original: Tyrion: ...Are you okay?
translation: Tyrion: ……你没事吧？

original: Aster: Yes...[p/] I was just thinking how unfortunate this ordeal has been.
translation: Aster: 没事……[p/]我只是在想这整起事件多么不幸。

original: Aster: I do hope Ms. Steelwind is taking this well.
translation: Aster: 我希望斯蒂尔文德女士没事。

original: Right...[p/] She is his fiancée after all.
translation: 是啊……[p/]毕竟她是他的未婚妻。

original: He must be extremely worried about her.
translation: 他肯定非常担心她。

original: Tyrion: We're trying to find out what exactly happened.
translation: Tyrion: 我们在试图弄清楚发生了什么。

original: Tyrion: Do you mind if we ask you some questions?
translation: Tyrion: 介意回答我们几个问题吗？

original: Aster: I...[p/] see.[p/] Well, I'll do whatever I can to help.
translation: Aster: 我……[p/]明白了。[p/]好的，我会尽力帮忙。

original: ...And yet [i]another[/i] inexplicable event is added to the list.
translation: ……现在<u>又多了一个</u>未解之谜。

original: After everything you've learned,[p/] you highly doubt that Steelwind was affected by Mageblight.
translation: 根据现在你所了解的内容，[p/]斯蒂尔文德不太可能感染了法师之疫。

original: So someone must be behind what happened...[p/] But who?
translation: 罪魁祸首一定另有其人……[p/]但会是谁？

original: Anyways,[p/] it seems he's told you everything he knows.
translation: 总之，[p/]他应该已经把知道的一切都告诉你了。

original: He probably didn't witness much after he was trapped by that [b]Force Cage[/b].
translation: 被[b]坚牢术[/b]困住以后他也应该没有看到多少东西。

original: You should MOVE somewhere else and follow your other leads.
translation: 你应该<size=1.5em>移动</size>到别处，追查其他线索。

original: Tyrion: This statue...
translation: Tyrion: 这雕像……

original: Tyrion: What [i]is[/i] this thing, by the way?
translation: Tyrion: 这到底是什么啊？

original: Tyrion: You called it a "pegasus" earlier.
translation: Tyrion: 你之前管这叫“天马”。

original: Beatrice: It's a creature of divine origin.
translation: Beatrice: 是来自神圣领域的生物。

original: Beatrice: Many people believe that the angels of the Upper Planes rode these creatures into battle.
translation: Beatrice: 很多人相信上层位面的天使会骑着这些生物征战沙场。

original: Tyrion: I see...
translation: Tyrion: 我明白了……

original: Beatrice: Do you feel some kinship to it?
translation: Beatrice: 你对它有亲近感吗？

original: Tyrion: ...I can only feel its suffering.
translation: Tyrion: ……我只能感受到它在受苦。

original: Celeste: What?
translation: Celeste: 什么？

original: Tyrion: Its face is contorted into an expression of pure agony.
translation: Tyrion: 它的面部表情因极度痛苦而扭曲。

original: Tyrion: It screams out in terror.[p/] Yet no one can hear its pleas for mercy.
translation: Tyrion: 它因恐惧而发出哀嚎。[p/]但没人能听见他乞求慈悲。

original: Tracker: Queen...[p/] I think he's broken.
translation: Tracker: 女皇……[p/]我觉得他疯掉了。

original: Tyrion: Someone ignorant of its plight has placed some sort of vain party hat upon its head.
translation: Tyrion: 不知它身处何种困境的人给它戴了一顶派对帽。

original: Tyrion: It's as if they are mocking its torment.[p/] Like some kind of demon torturing a poor soul in the fields of Avernus.
translation: Tyrion: 仿佛是在嘲讽它所受的折磨。就像是恶魔在地狱第一层阿佛纳斯折磨可怜的灵魂。

original: Celeste: What are you even saying...?
translation: Celeste: 你说什么玩意儿呢……？

original: Tyrion: I'm sorry...
translation: Tyrion: 抱歉……

original: Tyrion: I need to take a moment to think about what I've just witnessed here.
translation: Tyrion: 我需要花时间好好消化一下自己看到的东西。

original: Tyrion: We all should.
translation: Tyrion: 我们都应该这么做。

original: Celeste: Alright, Tyrion.[p/] You go do that.
translation: Celeste: 好吧，提利昂。[p/]你去吧。

original: Tyrion: So...[p/] You seem to be doing well...[p/] All things considered.
translation: Tyrion: 那么……[p/]虽然发生了这么多事……[p/]但你看起来过得不错。

original: Beatrice: You mean how a [i]demon[/i] now has ownership of my soul?
translation: Beatrice: 你是指我的灵魂被[b]恶魔[/b]所有这一点“不错”？

original: Tyrion: Y-[p/][s/]Yeah...[p/] [i]that[/i].
translation: Tyrion: 呃、[p/][s/]对……[p/]<u>这一点</u>。

original: Miriam: How can you be so calm about this?!
translation: Miriam: 你怎么能这么冷静？！

original: Liafal: I must agree with Miriam.[p/] It's a little unnerving how nonchalantly you're treating this.
translation: Liafal: 我不得不赞同米莉亚姆。[p/]你若无其事的态度有点吓人了。

original: Beatrice: I suppose it's the knowledge that everything is out of my hands now.
translation: Beatrice: 可能是因为我知道事情已经超出我的掌控吧。

original: Beatrice: There's something peaceful about it.
translation: Beatrice: 反而使我冷静下来。

original: Eris: ...[i]That's[/i] certainly a positive way to look at it.
translation: Eris: ……这确实是种乐观的态度。

original: Tyrion: You know...[p/] My offer still stands.[p/] I can try to help you.
translation: Tyrion: 记得吗……[p/]我的提议依然有效。[p/]我可以帮你。

original: Beatrice: At the risk of your [i]own[/i] life?
translation: Beatrice: 以<u>你自己的</u>生命冒险？

original: Tyrion: I...
translation: Tyrion: 我……

original: Beatrice: ...Which part of the contract would you dispute anyways?
translation: Beatrice: ……你要对契约的哪一部分提出异议？

original: The Divine Edict made you aware of every element in her Blood Contract.
translation: 神谕让你能够了解她的血契内容。

original: There was very little room for interpretation.[p/] It was airtight.
translation: 内容严谨，[p/]没有多少解读空间。

original: Beatrice: ...The demon I signed that contract with was very meticulous about the details.
translation: Beatrice: ……与我签约的恶魔非常注重细节。

original: Beatrice: I've spent the last five years looking for any possible loopholes.
translation: Beatrice: 我过去五年都一直在尝试找出漏洞。

original: Beatrice: But I didn't find anything substantial I could use.
translation: Beatrice: 但没有找到任何我可以利用的地方。

original: Beatrice: I don't even think disputing it is possible.
translation: Beatrice: 我不觉得提出异议可能成功。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tyrion: ...I'm sorry.
translation: Tyrion: ……抱歉。

original: Beatrice: Don't be.[p/] You defeated me.[p/] I won't suffer your pity.
translation: Beatrice: 不用。[p/]你打败了我。[p/]不需要可怜我。

original: Miriam: ...
translation: Miriam: ……

original: Tyrion: I feel like we always end up randomly meeting like this, Eris.
translation: Tyrion: 感觉我们的碰面总是这么突然，厄莉斯。

original: Tyrion: What brings you here?
translation: Tyrion: 你怎么在这儿？

original: Eris: I requested to accompany Beatrice to this...[p/] event.
translation: Eris: 我要求陪同比亚特丽丝参加这个……[p/]活动。

original: Eris: After all,[p/] I don't have many opportunities to enter a church like this.
translation: Eris: 毕竟我很少有机会进入这样的教堂。

original: Beatrice: ...I can imagine.
translation: Beatrice: ……能想象。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tyrion: By the way,[p/] is your father still-?
translation: Tyrion: 另外，[p/]你的爸爸还是——？

original: Eris: Oh,[p/] if you're worried about him,[p/] we've already had a conversation about you.
translation: Eris: 噢，[p/]如果你担心的是他，[p/]我们之前已经谈过你的事了。

original: Eris: I don't think he'll be accosting you any time soon.
translation: Eris: 他不会再来骚扰你了。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/][s/]Oh...[p/] Thank you.
translation: Tyrion: 噢、[p/][s/]噢……[p/]谢谢你。

original: Celeste: ...That seems too good to be true.
translation: Celeste: ……好得不像真的。

original: Celeste: How'd you pull something like [i]that[/i] off?
translation: Celeste: 你是怎么做到这种事的？

original: Eris: He may look like a hardened criminal,[p/] but he's always had a soft spot for his family.
translation: Eris: 他看起来可能是个凶狠暴徒，[p/]但他心里一直很重视家人。

original: Eris: He also owed me.[p/] And I have a way of making people see things my way.
translation: Eris: 也是他欠我的。[p/]我也有法子让人们从我的角度出发看问题。

original: Beatrice: She's right about that...
translation: Beatrice: 这点她说的没错……

original: Tyrion: Wait...[p/] If [i]you're[/i] here,[p/] does that mean Marrunath is also...?
translation: Tyrion: 等等……[p/]如果<u>你</u>在这里，[p/]那马鲁纳斯也……？

original: Beatrice: Oh, heavens no.[p/] There's no way they'd let me bring him [i]here[/i] of all places.
translation: Beatrice: 哦，当然不可能。[p/] 他们不可能允许我把他带到<u>这里</u>来的。

original: Beatrice: I left him at the entrance with the Kingsguard.
translation: Beatrice: 我把他留在入口的国王卫队那里了。

original: Beatrice: If he tries to escape,[p/] that knight over there is ordered to kill me.
translation: Beatrice: 如果他试图逃跑的话，[p/] 那边的骑士就会立刻杀了我。

original: She gestures towards a knight that's silently watching the sisters from afar.
translation: 她用手指了指在远处静静地看着弗雷加姐妹们的骑士。

original: Tyrion: You're...[p/] surprisingly calm about this.
translation: Tyrion: 你可真是……[p/] 惊人的冷静。

original: Beatrice: Please.[p/] I regularly deal with demons.[p/] [i]This[/i] is nothing in comparison to that.
translation: Beatrice: 拜托，[p/] 平时我可都是和恶魔打交道的。[p/] 这点程度算不了什么。

original: Liafal: ...You really haven't changed.
translation: Liafal: ……你还真是老样子。

original: Beatrice: I suppose not.
translation: Beatrice: 那是当然。

original: Tyrion: Wait, does that mean you can't see right now?
translation: Tyrion: 等下，那是不是意味着你现在看不见了？

original: Tyrion: How did you know which statue I was looking at?
translation: Tyrion: 你怎么知道我在看那座雕像的？

original: Beatrice: It was a lucky guess.
translation: Beatrice: 只是我碰巧猜对了而已。

original: Beatrice: ...That grotesque statue certainly makes an impression on you.
translation: Beatrice: ……那奇形怪状的雕像肯定会给你留下十分深刻的印象。

original: Beatrice: ...
translation: Beatrice: ……

original: Beatrice: Oh,[p/] Marrunath just spoke with me.
translation: Beatrice: 哦，[p/] 马鲁纳斯刚刚告诉我。

original: Beatrice: He wanted me to let you know that he can smell your "celestial stink" from the entrance.
translation: Beatrice: 他想让我告诉你他能在入口就闻到你身上那“天使般的恶臭”。

original: Tyrion: ...Love you too, Marrunath.
translation: Tyrion: ……这么在乎我？马鲁纳斯，我也会想着你的哦。

original: Beatrice: ...Oh,[p/] wow.
translation: Beatrice: ……哦，[p/] 哇哦。

original: Beatrice: I probably shouldn't repeat his response to [i]that[/i].
translation: Beatrice: 恐怕我不该转述他对<u>你那句话</u>的回应。

original: Tyrion: By the way,[p/] you seem to know a lot more about these things than I do.
translation: Tyrion: 总之，[p/] 在这些方面你似乎比我要懂得多。

original: Tyrion: What exactly [i]is[/i] a "heavensborn"?
translation: Tyrion: “天诞之物”到底<u>是</u>什么？

original: Beatrice: What?[p/] Did you seriously not know?
translation: Beatrice: 哈？[p/] 你真不知道？

original: Beatrice: But you know how to issue a Divine Edict.[p/] That's a very advanced technique.
translation: Beatrice: 但你知道如何使用神谕。[p/] 那可是个非常高级的技术。

original: Tyrion: It sort of...[p/] came to me in the moment...
translation: Tyrion: 当时是……[p/]突然就想到的……

original: Eris: ...What?
translation: Eris: ……什么？

original: Beatrice: Anyways,[p/] I'm [i]quite[/i] surprised you don't know about your lineage.
translation: Beatrice: 总之，[p/] 我<u>确实</u>对你不知道自己血脉这件事很震惊。

original: Tyrion: Perhaps my [i]mother[/i] knew.[p/] But I lost her when I was really young.
translation: Tyrion: 或许我<u>母亲</u>知道，[p/] 但我在很小的时候她就已经不在了。

original: Eris: ...
translation: Eris: ……

original: Beatrice: I see...[p/] You have my condolences.
translation: Beatrice: 我……明白了……[p/] 请节哀顺变。

original: Beatrice: But to answer your question,[p/] a heavensborn is a human whose bloodline has been touched by the gods.
translation: Beatrice: 但要回答你的问题，[p/] 天诞之物是指受神明接触过血脉的人类一族。

original: Tyrion: Gods?[p/] You mean like the Scaled Lord?
translation: Tyrion: 神明？[p/] 你是指像鳞甲领主这一类的？

original: Beatrice: No.[p/] I'm speaking of the [i]actual[/i] gods.
translation: Beatrice: 不。[p/] 我是指<u>真正</u>的神。

original: Liafal: Beatrice![p/][s/] You can't say that here!
translation: Liafal: 比亚特丽丝！[p/][s/] 你不能在这说这些事！

original: Beatrice: Oh, come off it.[p/] What's the Church going to do?[p/] [i]Arrest[/i] me?
translation: Beatrice: 哈啊，得了吧。[p/]教会会把我怎么样？[p/]<u>逮捕</u>我？

original: Beatrice: Anyways,[p/] your blood has been touched by the celestials of the Upper Planes.
translation: Beatrice: 言归正传，[p/]你的血脉曾被上层的天人触及。

original: Beatrice: ...Much like [i]my[/i] soul is bound to the Abyssal Hells.[p/] Your soul is consecrated and tied to the heavens.
translation: Beatrice: ……就像<u>我的</u>灵魂被深渊地狱所束缚住一样，[p/]你的灵魂经过升华且与天堂紧紧相连。

original: Tyrion: The heavens...?
translation: Tyrion: 天堂……？

original: Is [i]that[/i] why you're able to use the Eye of Horus?[p/] Is it some kind of... [i]angelic[/i] power?
translation: 难不成你能使用荷鲁斯之眼就是因为<u>这个</u>？[p/]是某种<u>天使般</u>的力量？

original: Beatrice: Make no mistake, though.
translation: Beatrice: 不过你可别搞错了。

original: Beatrice: If you find yourself under the wrong circumstances,[p/] even [i]you[/i] can be sent to Hell.
translation: Beatrice: 如果你发现自己处于某种错误的条件下，[p/]就算是你也会被送到地狱。

original: Tyrion: The Church of Bahamut is prominent in Wyverngarde,[p/] but this is the first time I've heard of the celestial gods.
translation: Tyrion: 虽说巴哈姆特教堂在维文加德境内十分有名，[p/]但这是我第一次听说天神的事。

original: Beatrice: Ah,[p/] that makes sense.
translation: Beatrice: 啊，[p/]那不无道理。

original: Beatrice: It's probably because of Wyverngarde's bloody history with the Theocracy of Lumina.
translation: Beatrice: 大概是因为维文加德的血腥建国史与卢米那神权息息相关。

original: Tyrion: The theocracy?[p/] Aren't they the nation east of us?
translation: Tyrion: 神权？[p/]你说我们东边那个国家？

original: Beatrice: Yes.[p/] The luminites worship the celestial gods,[p/] while [i]our[/i] people worship the ancient dragons.
translation: Beatrice: 是的。[p/]卢米那人崇拜天界神祇，[p/][i]我们[/i]则是崇拜古龙。

original: Beatrice: A few centuries ago,[p/] our nation was locked in a bitter war with the luminites.
translation: Beatrice: 几个世纪之前，[p/]我国和卢米那国打过仗。

original: Beatrice: Even now,[p/] the crown sees the celestial religions as a threat to our draconic culture.
translation: Beatrice: 即使至今，[p/]皇家依然认为天界宗教对我们的龙族信仰是个威胁。

original: Beatrice: The church has done its best to wipe out any religions that worship the Celestials.
translation: Beatrice: 教堂竭尽全力抹杀了任何崇拜天界的宗教。

original: Tyrion: I see...
translation: TYRION: 我知道了。

original: Celeste: But if your bloodline is blessed by the celestials,[p/] does that mean that our kids will [i]also[/i] be heavensborn?
translation: Celeste: 那如果说你的血脉受过天神的眷顾，[p/]是不是意味着我们的孩子<u>也</u>会是个天诞之物？

original: Tyrion: I suppose so.[p/] I think my mother was also a-...
translation: Tyrion: 应该是。[p/]我觉得我母亲应该也-……

original: Tyrion: Wait...[p/] What did you just say?
translation: Tyrion: 等等……[p/]你刚说什么？

original: Celeste: [i]Your[/i] kids.[p/][s/] I asked if "[i]your[/i] kids" will be heavensborn.
translation: Celeste: <u>你的</u>孩子。[p/][s/]我是说“<u>你的</u>孩子”会不会也会是天诞之物。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I must have misheard you then.
translation: Tyrion: 哦-[p/]哦……[p/]那我一定是听错了。

original: Miriam: Wow...
translation: Miriam: 哇哦……

original: Beatrice: ...If only you were [i]always[/i] this easy to lie to.
translation: Beatrice: ……要是你<u>总是</u>那么好骗就好了。

original: Beatrice: You seem to be doing well, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: Beatrice: 你看起来很有精神真是太好了，卡斯伯特先生。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Beatrice: ...Why are you looking at me like this?
translation: Beatrice: ……干嘛这样看着我？

original: Tyrion: ...Are you seriously not angry at me?
translation: Tyrion: ……你真的不生我的气吗？

original: Beatrice: At this point,[p/] what would my rage accomplish?
translation: Beatrice: 此时此刻，[p/]我为什么要生气？

original: Beatrice: You defeated me despite my best efforts.[p/] I suppose I respect you for that.
translation: Beatrice: 我尽了全力但你还是击败了我。[p/]我觉得我应该尊重你。

original: It sort of makes sense.[p/] But it's still a little unnerving how civil she's being.
translation: 有点道理，[p/]但她彬彬有礼的样子还是让你有点紧张。

original: Beatrice: *sigh*[p/] It seems that after all these years,[p/] Miriam still hasn't matured.
translation: Beatrice: *叹气*[p/]看起来这么多年过去了，[p/]米莉亚姆还没长大。

original: Miriam: ...What?!
translation: Miriam: ……什么？！

original: Beatrice: Oh, come now.[p/] You won't make any friends with that pompous attitude of yours.
translation: Beatrice: 唉，别这样。[p/]以你那种傲慢的态度谁会和你交朋友啊？

original: Miriam: I don't [i]need[/i] friends.
translation: Miriam: 我不<u>需要</u>朋友。

original: Miriam: [i]I'm[/i] a Frega,[p/] what need would I have for such things?
translation: Miriam: 我是弗雷加家的人，[p/]还需要什么？

original: Beatrice: You're a noblewoman.[p/] Your skills and intellect are worthless if you can't win over political allies.
translation: Beatrice: 你是贵族的一员。[p/]但如果你没办法赢得其他政治盟友的信任的话，你的一切才能和智慧都一文不值。

original: Beatrice: You will always have weaknesses.[p/] You need allies who can cover them and support you.
translation: Beatrice: 你将永远拥有弱点，[p/]你需要能在背后支持你并补齐你弱点的盟友。

original: Miriam: ...Like you and that demon?
translation: Miriam: ……就像你和那只恶魔一样？

original: Beatrice: ...Yes.[p/] That's [i]exactly[/i] what I mean.
translation: Beatrice: ……对的。[p/]<u>正是</u>如此。

original: Liafal: P-[p/][s/]Perhaps we should talk about something else.
translation: Liafal: 或-[p/][s/]或许我们该聊点别的。

original: Beatrice: Laefe.[p/] Are you really against marrying Jaiden von Sanctus?
translation: Beatrice: 拉菲。[p/]你是真的很不愿意与杰登·冯·桑克图斯结婚吗？

original: Liafal: Absolutely![p/][s/] That man is an ignorant know-it-all!
translation: Liafal: 当然不愿意！[p/][s/]那男人就是个什么都不知道但还不懂装懂的呆瓜！

original: Beatrice: But with Aster taken,[p/] there aren't many other suitors capable of strengthening House Frega.
translation: Beatrice: 但在阿斯特被排除在外的情况下，[p/]已经没有什么能让弗雷加家进一步强大的人选了。

original: Liafal: I just...[p/] [i]can't[/i] marry someone that I don't love.
translation: Liafal: 我就是……[p/]<u>没办法</u>与我不爱的人结婚。

original: Beatrice: I see...[p/] Well, I won't push you then.
translation: Beatrice: 我明白了……[p/]好吧，我不会再逼你了。

original: Beatrice: But I want to make sure you're taken care of when I'm gone.
translation: Beatrice: 但我必须确保在我不在了之后有人能照顾好你。

original: Miriam: Stop talking like that![p/][s/] It's as if you're [i]planning[/i] on dying!
translation: Miriam: 不许说这种话！[p/][s/]搞得好像你<u>一心</u>想死一样！

original: Miriam: You're [i]not[/i] leaving us again!
translation: Miriam: <u>不许</u>再离我们而去了！

original: Liafal: Miriam...
translation: Liafal: 米莉亚姆……

original: Miriam: I-[p/][s/]I'm sorry...[p/] I don't know what came over me.
translation: Miriam: 抱-[p/][s/]抱歉……[p/]我不知道我刚刚是怎么了。

original: Beatrice: ...My apologies.[p/] Perhaps I shouldn't have said that.
translation: Beatrice: ……是我的错。[p/]我不该那样说的。

original: Beatrice: ...I hope Aster is okay.[p/] He was never emotionally strong.
translation: Beatrice: ……希望阿斯特没事。[p/]他在情感上没那么坚强。

original: Tyrion: ...What do you mean?
translation: Tyrion: ……这是什么意思？

original: Beatrice: Wait...[p/] Do you [i]not[/i] know why we're all gathered here?
translation: Beatrice: 等下……[p/]你<u>不</u>知道我们为什么聚在这吗？

original: Tyrion: ...I wanted to ask but-.
translation: Tyrion: ……我想问的但-

original: Beatrice: I'm sorry, then.[p/] It's not my place to tell you.
translation: Beatrice: 我很抱歉，[p/]但由我来告诉你不太合适。

original: Why [i]are[/i] they all gathered here?
translation: 为什么他们都聚在这？

original: Beatrice: I wonder.[p/] Is Aria still a complete mess when she's around Aster?
translation: Beatrice: 话说回来，阿莉亚还是会在阿斯特面前表现的一团糟吗？

original: Celeste: Yep.
translation: Celeste: 没错。

original: Beatrice: ...I [i]want[/i] to be happy for her.
translation: Beatrice: ……我想为她高兴。

original: Beatrice: Even when we were engaged,[p/] she was completely infatuated with him.
translation: Beatrice: 即使我们当时已经订婚了，[p/]她还是彻彻底底的迷恋着他。

original: Celeste: [i]That[/i] sounds...[p/] awkward.
translation: Celeste: <u>那</u>听起来……[p/]挺尴尬的。

original: Beatrice: I do hope she can learn to be happy with him.
translation: Beatrice: 我衷心地希望她也能领会到与他在一起时的快乐。

original: Beatrice: ...Have you spoken with Tymora since the trial?
translation: Beatrice: ……自那次庭审后你有和泰摩拉聊过吗？

original: Tyrion: ...No.[p/] I haven't.
translation: Tyrion: ……没有，[p/]还没聊过。

original: Beatrice: She really [i]does[/i] care for you.
translation: Beatrice: 她是真的<u>很</u>在乎你。

original: Beatrice: I remember.[p/] Even during the court case,[p/] she would speak of you constantly.
translation: Beatrice: 我记得，[p/] 即使是在庭审过程中，[p/]她也经常提到你。

original: Tyrion: ...Could we talk about something else?
translation: Tyrion: ……我们能换个话题吗？

original: Beatrice: ...Of course,[p/] my apologies.
translation: Beatrice: ……当然可以，[p/]非常抱歉。

original: Tyrion: What can you tell me about this, Beatrice?
translation: Tyrion: 比亚特丽丝，关于这个你知道些什么吗？

original: Beatrice: Sorry, I can't really say anything about that.
translation: Beatrice: 抱歉，我对此一无所知。

original: ...You find yourself in the Grand Cathedral's garden and stumble upon a strange statue.
translation: ……你发现自己身处大教堂的花园中，并偶然发现一座奇怪的雕像。

original: Celeste: Wow...[p/] [i]That's[/i] a little out of place.
translation: Celeste: 哇哦……[p/]那雕像有点突兀了。

original: Celeste: What even [i]is[/i] it?
translation: Celeste: 这到底是什么？

original: Beatrice: If my memory is correct,[p/] it's a pegasus.
translation: Beatrice: 如果我没记错的话，[p/] 那是珀伽索斯。

original: Celeste: Ah!
translation: Celeste: 啊！

original: Tracker: Hello, friends!
translation: Tracker: 朋友们，你们好！

original: As you inspect the...[p/] contemporary piece of artwork,[p/] you're startled by a familiar voice.
translation: 就在你欣赏这座……[p/] 当代艺术品的时候，[p/]你被一个熟悉的声音吓了一跳。

original: ...And it looks like she's not alone either.
translation: ……而且看来她还不是一个人。

original: Along with Eris,[p/] she seems to be accompanied by both of her sisters.
Tyrion: B-[p/][s/]Beatrice![p/][s/] Aren't you supposed to be-!
Beatrice: ...Dead?
Tyrion: ...S-[p/][s/]Sorry...[p/] I wasn't trying to say-
Beatrice: No.[p/] It's perfectly understandable.
Beatrice: [i]You[/i] of all people know what was on my Blood Contract.
Beatrice: But it appears the Lady of Discord isn't going to use me just yet.
Beatrice: But it appears the Lady of Discord isn't going to kill me just yet.
Beatrice: Ugh...[p/] Do you [i]really[/i] have to do that?
Tyrion: ...What?
Beatrice: ...Never mind.
Eris: ...
Tyrion: ...Right.
It's a little awkward speaking to the Frega sisters after everything that's happened.
But they don't seem hostile.[p/] And all things considered,[p/] you prefer their company over Sibyl's.
Although...[p/] you're still not sure how you feel about speaking with a murderer,[p/] especially one that [i]you[/i] indicted.
But Beatrice clearly knows more about demons and their kind than you do.
You wonder if she knows anything about the "heavensborn".
Tyrion: Anyways,[p/] I'm a little curious about the Theocracy of Lumina...
Tyrion: If they worship celestials there,[p/] would I find [i]other[/i] heavensborn there?
Beatrice: Heavensborn aren't that common [i]there[/i] either.
Beatrice: Frankly,[p/] I'm surprised there's even [i]one[/i] heavensborn living in Wyverngarde.
Beatrice: How did your bloodline even find its way here?
Tyrion: ...I suppose I don't really know.
Tyrion: My mother never told me much about our ancestry.
Beatrice: That makes sense...[p/] If the Church of Bahamut knew what you were,[p/] they would have definitely hunted you down.
Great...[p/] The last thing you need is [i]another[/i] faction that wants to kill you.
Beatrice: Anyways,[p/] travel into and out of Wyverngarde is technically illegal.
Beatrice: And I doubt Lord Steelwind would make an exemption for you.
Beatrice: After all,[p/] House Steelwind was essentially founded by veterans of the Great Luminite War.
Tracker: ..."Veteran"?
Tracker: ...Vet?!
Liafal: Oh no...[p/]
Tracker: No![p/][s/] I hate the vet![p/][s/] I'm not going!
Tracker: You'll never take me alive!
Tracker: [i]ARF ARF ARF ARF ARF[/i]!
You all watch as Tracker frantically runs through the garden,[p/] barking loudly.
Laefe chases after him as he runs towards a passing knight.
Miriam: I should probably go help her.
Tyrion: It's almost 2:00 PM, anyways.[p/] We should head to the Prayer Room.
Beatrice: ...
translation: Beatrice: ……

original: Tyrion: Thank you for answering my questions, Beatrice.
Tyrion: Please let me know if there's anything I can do to help you with your...[p/] situation...
Beatrice: ...Of course.
Tyrion: Let's go, Celeste.
Celeste: Right.
Beatrice: ...
translation: Beatrice: ……

original: Eris: Try not to look so down.[p/] It's almost time for the main event.
Beatrice: ...Why did you bring me here?
Eris: Oh,[p/] who knows?
Beatrice: Whatever you're planning to make me do...[p/] Please.
Beatrice: [i]Please[/i] don't make me harm my sisters.
Eris: You're in no position to make demands.
Eris: You'll just have to see for yourself.
Beatrice: ...
translation: Beatrice: ……

original: Beatrice: ...Stay safe, Mr. Cuthbert.
Celeste: I've...[p/] killed people...
Celeste: They were usually criminals or bandits.
Celeste: But it still frightened me how unaffected I was by their deaths.
Celeste: It always came so easily to me.[p/] I was good at it...[p/] a little [i]too[/i] good.
Celeste: People told me that taking the lives of others would be hard.
Celeste: But I never felt that uneasiness...[p/] Not even once...
Celeste: It made me think that I was some kind of unfeeling monster...
Celeste: ...And maybe I [i]am[/i].
Celeste: But the time I spent with you filled me with more happiness than I could have ever dreamed of.
Celeste: Instead of taking lives,[p/] I could save them alongside you.
Celeste: It felt good to protect you.[p/] I felt needed when I knew you were relying on me.
Celeste: It made me feel like I was actually worth something to someone.
Celeste: And whenever I saw the light in your eyes,[p/] it filled my heart with a warm feeling that I've never felt before.
Celeste: ...But it was too good to be true, wasn't it?
Celeste: In the end,[p/] I failed you.
Celeste: I couldn't protect you.[p/] Just like I couldn't protect my father.
Celeste: I don't understand...[p/] What did you ever see in someone like me...?
Celeste: ...Tyrion?
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Celeste: You still haven't gotten out of bed yet.[p/] It's almost noon.
Tyrion: ...I think I just want to rest today.
Celeste: ...You've been saying that for the last ten days.
Celeste: ...Someone is actually here to see you.
Celeste: You should [i]really[/i] get out of bed.
Tyrion: ...Is it Tymora?
Celeste: No.
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tyrion: ...I'm still not really in the mood.[p/] Can you just send them away?
Aria: That's a bit rude,[p/] but I suppose I can overlook it this time.
Tyrion: S-[p/][s/]Steelwind?!
As the prosecutor enters your room,[p/] you immediately leap out of your bed.
You try to futilely clean your unkempt hair.[p/] But you're just making it worse.
Celeste: T-[p/][s/]Tyrion...![p/][s/] Pants!
Tyrion: R-[p/][s/]Right![p/][s/] Sorry!
Aria: ...We'll give you some time to ready yourself.
Aria: I knew he was in a rut...[p/] But I certainly didn't expect...[p/] [i]this[/i].
Celeste: I know.[p/] I'm really worried about him.
Aria: I empathize with his situation,[p/] but it's been a month already.
Aria: Have you tried speaking with him?
Aria: He [i]has[/i] opened up to you before.
Celeste: I did.[p/] But I think he's really broken up over what happened with Ruby.
Celeste: She's basically the closest thing he had to family.
Aria: I see...[p/] Perhaps he just needs more time.
After taking some time to make yourself presentable,[p/] you exit your room to greet the prosecutor properly.
Tyrion: S-[p/][s/]Sorry about that...
Aria: No,[p/] I suppose the fault is mine.[p/] I shouldn't have intruded.
Tyrion: Anyways,[p/] what brings you here?
Tyrion: It's a bookshelf filled with several fantasy fiction novels.
Tyrion: There are a lot of books from a series that I've read.
Tyrion: I never got a chance to look at this painting the last time we were here.
Tyrion: He looks like some kind of crime lord.
Knight: If I'm right,[p/] he was one of the [i]previous[/i] Eyetakers.
Knight: Back then,[p/] he had an even [i]tighter[/i] grip on the criminal underbelly of Ratholme.
Knight: People used to call him "The Raging Storm".
Tyrion: ...But isn't "Eyetaker" [i]already[/i] a nickname?
Knight: Look, sir.[p/] [i]I[/i] don't come up with these names.
Tyrion: It looks like this fireplace hasn't been lit in a while.
Tyrion: But I can still see the burnt remnants of some documents.
Tyrion: I can see the back alley entrance from this window.
Tyrion: The Eyetaker must have used this to get a good look at visitors.
Tyrion: It's the table that the Eyetaker sat at the last time you were here.
Tyrion: There's a thick layer of dust on it now.
Tyrion: There are several fantasy novels stacked on the desk here.
Tyrion: The Eyetaker must be a fan of the genre.
Tyrion: ...What?
Celeste: There's no one here...
Tyrion: ...Damn it!
Of [i]course[/i] he's not here.
You betrayed him and you [i]knew[/i] where his hideout was.
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: You take a close look at the desk he was sitting at during your previous visit.
There's a thick layer of dust on it.[p/]
It doesn't look like anyone's been here for a while.
He must have moved his operation elsewhere the day you convicted Beatrice.
Celeste: *sigh*[p/] I guess there's no point in staying hidden anymore.
You see Celeste toss the Kingsguard's runestone onto the ground.
A few seconds later,[p/] you hear the footfalls of soldiers rushing towards your location.
Knight: Freeze in the name of the Wyverngarde-!
You see him freeze as he scans the room and sees no one else there.
Knight: ...Be careful, sir.[p/][s/] They appear to have turned themselves invisible!
Tyrion: They're not [i]here[/i], you idiot!
Knight: ...Oh.
You let out a frustrated sigh as you take a seat on a chair nearby.
A cloud of dust is launched into the air as you do so.
Tyrion: He had the last piece we needed...
Tyrion: None of the other suspects had the means nor the motive to do this.
Tyrion: But he's probably long gone by now...
Tyrion: It's over.
Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Celeste: I'm sorry.
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Celeste: But you did everything you could, didn't you?
Tyrion: ...But it wasn't good enough.
A part of you knew that it was a long shot.
If he were involved in this,[p/] he'd definitely keep his head down.
Tyrion: ...What do we do now?
Tyrion: There [i]has[/i] to be someone who knows where he is.
Wait a minute...
Tyrion: Actually...[p/] There is [i]one[/i] person who might know where he is.
Celeste: What do you-?
Celeste: Wait...[p/] You don't mean...
Tyrion: ...At this point,[p/] it's the only option we have.
Celeste: Are you sure?[p/] You two aren't exactly-
Tyrion: I know...[p/] But I can't let my personal feelings get in the way of saving Aria.
You're not looking forward to seeing her again...
...At least,[p/] that's what you keep telling yourself.
Ugh...[p/] You'll have to process these feelings later.
You have a job to do.
Tyrion: There's a chalk outline where Pierce's body probably was.
Tyrion: It looks like he was sitting against this altar when he died.
Tyrion: And the blood stain seems to imply that the fatal wound came from his chest.
Tyrion: An autopsy report would really be helpful here...
You should ask the commander for a copy of it the next time you see him.
Celeste: There's...[p/] a trace of [b]necromancy[/b] on the ground here.
Celeste: It's...[p/] probably from when I tried to heal you.
Celeste: O-[p/]Oh![p/] There's a trace of [b]transmutation[/b] here.
Celeste: It's all over the area around his body.
Tyrion: Interesting...[p/] Did the murderer wound him using a [b]transmutation[/b] spell?
Celeste: There are traces of [b]conjuration[/b] magic all over the room.
Tyrion: That must have been left by Beatrice's [b]Sleep[/b] spell.
Tyrion: There are lanterns hanging around the room.

Celeste: They're definitely going to send someone after him. [mind="...And he can't really take care of himself right now."/]
Tyrion: ...Celeste.[p/] Your thoughts are leaking.
Celeste: Hey...[p/] Get out of my head.
Aria: ...What?
Tyrion: ...It's nothing.
Aria: I [i]am[/i] surprised, though.[p/] Not many people slight the Eyetaker and live.
Aria: He's known for taking swift retaliation against his enemies.
Celeste: We're hoping he's laying low after his plan with Beatrice fell through.
Aria: That [i]does[/i] match with the reports I've read.
Aria: Supposedly,[p/] he's been absent from many of his enterprises.
Either way...[p/] You're not looking forward to dealing with him.
It's bad enough that you're already on the nobility's bad side.
Celeste: ...By the way, Tyrion.[p/] Ruby sent another letter.
Celeste: Do you want to-?
Tyrion: ...Put it with the rest.
Celeste: R-[p/]Right...
Aria: ...Have you spoken to her since the trial?
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Aria: I see...[p/] That [i]does[/i] explain her recent mood.
Celeste: Right.[p/] You two probably see each other a lot.
Aria: I've prosecuted a few of her clients recently.
Aria: But it's clear she's not nearly as threatening as before.
Tyrion: ...Could we talk about something else?
Aria: Of course.[p/] My apologies.
Aria: Are you doing well, Mr. Cuthbert?[p/] You seem...
Tyrion: I'm fine.[p/] Why wouldn't I be?
Aria: ...Of course.
Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Aria: It's just that you haven't taken any other clients since Beatrice's trial.
Tyrion: I'm going to be honest.[p/] I'm not even sure if I [i]want[/i] to be a defense attorney anymore.
Celeste: What?
Tyrion: I've been following this path for so long...[p/] But I was only doing it because someone else told me to.
Aria: Did you not enjoy it?[p/] As much as I hate to admit it,[p/] you were very skilled at it.
Tyrion: I don't know anymore.[p/] That's why I've been taking some time to think about my life.
Tyrion: ...But I still haven't found any answers.
Aria: ...
translation: Aria: ……

original: Aria: Have you considered becoming a prosecutor?
Aria: Your time as my stand-in showed that you definitely have the ability to.
Tyrion: ...A prosecutor.
The idea would have been laughable a year ago...
But now you know that there are criminals who need to be brought to justice.
It's definitely intriguing.[p/] At the very least,[p/] you don't have any other options.
Tyrion: ...I'll think about it.
Aria: Please do.[p/] I could use all the help I can get.
Tyrion: Have your injuries been healing well?
Aria: Yes.[p/] Nightgrave's skill in [b]necromancy[/b] is quite remarkable.
Aria: I'm glad I introduced him to Lord Asclepius.
Tyrion: Lord Asclepius?
Aria: House Asclepius specializes in [b]necromancy[/b] magic.
Aria: After his expulsion from the academy,[p/] I thought it was only right that he be allowed to continue his studies.
Celeste: Right.[p/] He mentioned that he owed you a favor.
Aria: It was only logical.[p/] It would be a waste to let someone of his talents fade into obscurity.
Aria: I was actually surprised to see you here, Celeste.
Celeste: Well...[p/] I can't just leave him alone anymore.[p/] He ticked off a criminal overlord.
Celeste: They're definitely going to send someone after him. [mind="...And he can't really take care of himself right now."/]
Tyrion: ...Celeste.[p/] Your thoughts are leaking.
Celeste: Hey...[p/] Get out of my head.
Aria: ...What?
Tyrion: ...It's nothing.
Aria: I [i]am[/i] surprised, though.[p/] Not many people slight the Eyetaker and live.
Aria: He's known for taking swift retaliation against his enemies.
Celeste: We're hoping he's laying low after his plan with Beatrice fell through.
Aria: That [i]does[/i] match with the reports I've read.
Aria: Supposedly,[p/] he's been absent from many of his enterprises.
Celeste: ...By the way, Tyrion.[p/] Ruby sent another letter.
Celeste: Do you want to-?
Tyrion: ...Put it with the rest.
Celeste: R-[p/]Right...
Aria: ...Have you spoken to her since the trial?
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Aria: I see...[p/] That [i]does[/i] explain her recent mood.
Celeste: Right.[p/] You two probably see each other a lot.
Aria: I've prosecuted a few of her clients recently.
Aria: But it's clear she's not nearly as threatening as before.
Tyrion: ...Could we talk about something else?
Aria: Of course.[p/] My apologies.
Aria: ...Why are you showing this to me?
Tyrion: S-[p/]Sorry.[p/] Force of habit.
Celeste: Oh![p/] The tea's ready.
Aria: Oh,[p/] thank you.[p/] Some tea sounds lovely right now.
Celeste: R-[p/]Right...[p/] I was [i]totally[/i] making it for you guys.
She walks to the cabinet in your kitchen.[p/] And she takes out two more tea cups.
Celeste: You guys better enjoy this.[p/] These are my last bags of-
Celeste: W-[p/][s/]Woah!
As she walks over to you,[p/] she slips on a scroll case that you left on the floor.
She regains her balance,[p/] but the teacups slip out of her hands.[p/] The boiling liquid is airborne and is heading right toward your face.
Celeste: [b]Figaqua[/b]!
Celeste reacts immediately and points her index finger at the tea.
Her magic takes hold,[p/] and the tea freezes just inches from your face.
She breathes a sigh of relief,[p/] and she brings the tea back into their cups.
Celeste: You really need to clean this place.
Celeste: I'm your bodyguard,[p/] not your maid.
Tyrion: R-[p/][s/]Right.[p/] Sorry about that...
Aria: That was [b]Shape Liquid[/b], wasn't it?
Celeste: Yeah...
Tyrion: Oh...[p/] I never expected you to-
Celeste: I know...[p/] But it's just too convenient [i]not[/i] to have.
She's really opened her mind about learning new spells.
You remember when you first met her.
Back then,[p/] she only knew how to cast [b]Mage Blade[/b].
She hated magic back then...[p/] You never imagined how diverse her repertoire would become.
Celeste: ...[i]Another[/i] visitor?
Tyrion: I'm already up.[p/] I'll check it.
Celeste: Well [i]whoever[/i] they are,[p/] I'm not giving up any more of my Lotus Tea.
You open the door and don't see anyone.[p/] But there's a letter in your mailbox.
You take a closer look at the envelope.[p/] It's sealed with candle wax.
There's a crest on it...[p/][s/] It's the insignia of House Pierce!
You quickly open the letter and read it.
Despite supposedly being written by a noble,[p/] the paper has been torn in half.[p/] But the message is clear.
Garrick: [i]I hope you understand...[p/] I would've never contacted you unless I had no other choice.[/i]
Garrick: [i]I know the truth behind McCoy's [i]true[/i] parentage.[p/] And I'm aware of how vital this information is to you.[/i]
Garrick: [i]As you know,[p/] my execution is scheduled for next month.[p/] And I'm running out of time.[/i]
Garrick: [i]I want to trade this information with you.[p/] In exchange,[p/] you [b]will[/b] grant me my freedom.[/i]
Garrick: [i]Meet me in the private Prayer Room within the Grand Cathedral of the Scaled Lord at 2:00 PM...[/i]
Garrick: [i]You [b]will[/b] save me from my fate,[p/] or else[/i]
Tyrion: ...What?!
Celeste: If he thinks for a second that we'd even [i]think[/i] of helping him-!
Tyrion: I know how you feel.[p/] But aren't these the answers you've been looking for?
Celeste: I don't care![p/][s/] We're [i]not[/i] going to help him!
Tyrion: That was never an option.[p/] But there's clearly more to this.
Aria: ...I agree.[p/] How was he able to find out in the first place?
Aria: The truth is, Celeste...[p/] I've also been looking into your parentage.
Celeste: What?!
Celeste: Why didn't you say anything?!
Aria: I'm sorry.[p/] But I didn't want to raise your hopes.
Aria: And I was apparently right to do so.[p/] I couldn't find [i]any[/i] information regarding your birth.
Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Tyrion: So if [i]you[/i] couldn't find anything,[p/] how was [i]Pierce[/i] able to?
Aria: House Pierce is low on the political hierarchy.[p/] He doesn't have access to the resources I do.
Aria: He [i]does[/i] own the land the McCoy Tavern is on.
Aria: But frankly,[p/] this whole situation is quite suspect.
Tyrion: And why would he ask for [i]my[/i] help?[p/] [i]I[/i] was the one who indicted him in the first place.
Tyrion: Even if I [i]did[/i] agree to help him,[p/] it would be nearly impossible for me to get him an acquittal.
Aria: He must be desperate.
Aria: His execution is scheduled for next month, after all.
Aria: It's possible that he reached out to Tymora as well.
Aria: Still...[p/] I can't believe he'd set up a meeting at the Grand Cathedral, [i]today[/i] of all days.
Tyrion: ...Why?[p/] What's happening there?
Aria: I'm sorry...[p/] But it's not my place to tell you.
Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Celeste: Aria,[p/] can I talk with Tyrion alone for a minute?
Aria: Of course.[p/] I'm sure you have much to discuss.
Aria: I actually also have business at the Cathedral today. [mind="I can't believe he'd use that as an opportunity."/]
Aria: I'll be taking my leave.
Tyrion: I'm sorry...[p/] I'm sure this is just bringing up bad memories for you.
Celeste: ...We should meet with him.
Tyrion: ...What?
Celeste: We're not going to help him, obviously.[p/] But I had an idea.
Celeste: He's probably really scared of his execution, right?[p/] And he's desperate enough to ask [i]you[/i] for help.
Tyrion: I suppose that's true...
Celeste: So...[p/] Think about how stressed he would be if you showed up and refused to help him.
Tyrion: ...!
translation: Tyrion: ……！

original: Tyrion: I could use the Eye of Horus on him.
Celeste: We can get the info we need without having to give him [i]anything[/i].
Tyrion: ...But are you really okay with this?[p/] You'll have to see him again.
Celeste: Yeah...[p/] I'll manage.
Celeste: And it'll be worth it if we can finally get the answers I'm looking for.
You've already gotten her hopes up,[p/] but there's no guarantee that he actually knows the truth.
He could just be bluffing to get you to help him.
...But if he [i]does[/i] know.[p/] You can't just ignore this.
You need to verify his claims yourself.
Celeste: So [i]this[/i] is the Grand Cathedral of the Scaled Lord.
Tyrion: Have you never been here before?
Tyrion: I thought you spent a lot of time in Ratholme.
Celeste: The Church of Bahamut wasn't that popular in my hometown.[p/] And I've never been the religious type.
Celeste: What about you?
Tyrion: It never really caught on with me.
Tyrion: ...And apparently my roots are more celestial than draconic.
Celeste: Yeah.[p/] I guess that makes sense. [mind="He certainly has the looks for it..."/]
Tyrion: ...Your thoughts are leaking again.
Celeste: Can you stop?
Tyrion: I can't exactly turn it off, you know.
Tyrion: Do those mental exercises I taught you.
Celeste: Ugh...
As you approach the Grand Cathedral,[p/] you see a large blockade guarded by legions of the Kingsguard.
Celeste: It's closed off...[p/] Is there some kind of event going on?
You recall Steelwind mentioning that she was heading here as well.
The nobility must be using the cathedral grounds for something.
It might explain why Pierce wanted to meet you here.[p/] It's probably secluded from prying eyes today.
Knight: ...Tyrion Cuthbert?
As you approach the blockade,[p/] one of the knights notices you.
He glances at you and Celeste.
Knight: ...We've been expecting you.
Tyrion: I...[p/] see.
You exchange glances with Celeste.[p/] But you both enter the cathedral grounds.
The main building is massive...[p/] yet mostly empty.
You only see a few people within,[p/] and most of them are quite familiar.
You spot Laefe and Miriam as you head further into the room.
They both avoid eye contact with you.[p/] But it doesn't seem to be [i]purely[/i] out of resentment.
As soon as they see you,[p/] they move their conversation elsewhere.
It's clear they still have mixed feelings about how you convicted their sister.
In another corner of the room,[p/] you spot Lloyd von Sanctus speaking with another individual.
She seems to be someone of equal social standing.
You feel like you've seen her somewhere before.[p/] But you can't quite remember where.
As soon as you enter the room,[p/] von Sanctus flashes a quick look of disdain at you.
You see him slowly move his conversation out of the room as well.
And finally,[p/] you see Lucio Steelwind speaking with his daughter.
...along with the two princes.
They seem to speaking with another individual that you haven't met before.
When he notices you,[p/] his gaze narrows.[p/] And he stares at the two of you warily.
Aster, especially, seems surprised to see you here.
He and Lucio ask the prosecutor something.[p/] But you can't quite hear their conversation.
When she responds,[p/] Aster raises his eyebrows and Lucio's expression darkens.
What's going on here?
Celeste: This is a little awkward.
Tyrion: Yeah...
Tyrion: But we have some time before our meeting with Pierce.
Tyrion: ...You want to do some sightseeing?
Celeste: Oh?[p/] Are you asking me out?
Tyrion: We are [i]literally[/i] already out.
Celeste: Sure.[p/] Why not?
Celeste: I picked up this map from the entrance.[p/] We can use it to navigate through the area.
Celeste: I'm also a little interested in what all these nobles are doing here.
It [i]is[/i] strange.[p/] Perhaps someone can tell you more.

original: MBeatrice: I was with my sisters and my...[p/] guide,[p/] Eris Illmater.
translation: MBeatrice: 我当时和妹妹们以及……[p/]向导，[p/]厄莉斯·伊尔马特在一起。

original: MBeatrice: I was speaking with them in the garden,[p/] when I suddenly felt ill and lost consciousness.
translation: MBeatrice: 我们在花园里交谈，[p/]然后我突然感觉不适，失去了意识。

original: MBeatrice: When I woke up,[p/] my sisters found me.[p/] They said that I had gone missing for over an hour.
translation: MBeatrice: 醒来以后，[p/]妹妹们找到了我。[p/]她们说我失踪超过一小时了。

original: MBeatrice: I was confused.[p/] But when I later heard what happened,[p/] I realized that someone must have taken control of my body.
translation: MBeatrice: 我很困惑。[p/]但我之后听说了发生的事，[p/]也意识到有人操控了我的身体。

original: MBeatrice: I have no memories of what happened.[p/] And from what I understand,[p/] the same thing happened to Aria.
translation: MBeatrice: 我不记得发生了什么。[p/]阿莉亚似乎也有相同遭遇。

original: MBeatrice: And to make matters worse,[p/] there's [i]nothing[/i] that indicates who may have controlled our actions.
translation: MBeatrice: 更麻烦的是，[p/][i]没有[/i]任何线索指明存在幕后黑手。

original: Player: Overflow
Player: Objection
Orym: It all started when we received a report from the Kingsguard.[p/] The prosecutor attacked Prince Alaric and a fire had broken out in the Common Room.
translation: Orym: 一切都要从我们收到国王卫队报告时说起。[p/]检察官攻击了阿拉里克王子，公共休息室还着火了。

original: Orym: We weren't sure what the deal with Steelwind was.[p/] So we went to the Common Room to put out the fire.
translation: Orym: 我们不确定斯蒂尔文德那边怎么回事。[p/]就先去公共休息室帮忙灭火。

original: Orym: When we got there,[p/] we noticed a bunch of unconscious knights in front of the Prayer Room.
translation: Orym: 但我们抵达时，[p/]发现一群卫兵昏倒在祷告室前。

original: Orym: We went to the Prayer Room.[p/] That's when we found Steelwind and Cuthbert unconscious next to Pierce's dead body.
translation: Orym: 我们就先去了祷告室。[p/]也在那里发现了皮尔斯的尸体，以及旁边失去意识的斯蒂尔文德和卡斯伯特。

original: Orym: We later found the bodies of von Sanctus and Sibyl too.[p/] That's when we realized that she offed all three of them.
translation: Orym: 之后我们也发现了冯·桑克图斯和希比尔的尸体。[p/]这时我们才意识到三个人都是被她杀害的。

original: Orym: Steelwind must have attacked von Sanctus in the Common Room and suffocated him somehow.
translation: Orym: 斯蒂尔文德肯定是在公共休息室攻击了冯·桑克图斯，使其窒息。

original: Orym: From the burns on his body,[p/] she must have hit him with a [b]Fire Bolt[/b] to keep him from getting away.[p/] He didn't have anything to defend himself with.
translation: Orym: 根据尸体上的烧伤，[p/]他应该先被[b]火焰箭[/b]击中，无法逃走。[p/]他也没有任何自卫手段。

original: Orym: Steelwind must have attacked Sibyl somewhere close to that balcony.[p/] And going by the autopsy report,[p/] she must have suffocated her somehow.
translation: Orym: 斯蒂尔文德肯定是在阳台附近攻击了希比尔。[p/]根据尸检报告，[p/]她用某种手段令其窒息。

original: Orym: We later discovered her body in Lake Galakrond.[p/] From the High Speaker's testimony,[p/] Steelwind must have dumped her body from the balcony above.
translation: Orym: 我们之后在迦拉克隆湖里发现了她的尸体。[p/]根据大主教的证言，[p/]斯蒂尔文德肯定是从正上方阳台处弃尸。

original: Orym: From McCoy's testimony,[p/] we know that Steelwind killed Pierce in the Prayer Room.
translation: Orym: 根据麦考伊的证言，[p/]斯蒂尔文德在祷告室杀了皮尔斯。

original: Orym: She probably didn't have time to suffocate him like the other two.[p/] So she must have improvised a weapon using [b]Shape Liquid[/b].
translation: Orym: 她大概没时间采取之前的窒息手段了。[p/]就临机应变，用[b]形变液体[/b]做了一把武器。

original: Player: Overflow
Player: Objection
Theon: I was doing some paperwork in my quarters and I suppose I lost track of the time.[p/] My alarm went off and I realized that it was time for my afternoon prayers.
translation: Theon: 我在住所进行文书工作，忙到忘了时间。[p/]听到闹钟才想起来，该进行下午的祷告了。

original: Theon: I was in my quarters when my alarm went off at 2:10 PM.[p/] I realized that it was time for my afternoon prayers.
translation: Theon: 下午 2:10 闹钟响的时候，我在房间里。[p/]听见铃声才意识到该进行下午的祷告了。

original: Theon: I began heading to the Prayer Room when I spotted Lady Steelwind looking over the west-ward balcony.
translation: Theon: 我向着祷告室出发，发现斯蒂尔文德女士正在西侧阳台往下看。

original: Theon: I began heading to the Prayer Room when I spotted Lady Steelwind looking over the west-ward balcony.[p/] This happened before 2:15 PM.
translation: Theon: 我向着祷告室出发，发现斯蒂尔文德女士正在西侧阳台往下看。[p/]时间是下午 2:15 之前。

original: Theon: I tried to greet her but she didn't respond to me.[p/] That's when I noticed she was pushing something large over the balcony and into Lake Galakrond.
translation: Theon: 我向她打招呼，但被无视了。[p/]这时我发现，她正从阳台把什么大东西推入迦拉克隆湖。

original: Theon: It was still before 2:15 PM.[p/] Our encounter was short.[p/] That's when I noticed she was pushing something large over the balcony and into Lake Galakrond.
translation: Theon: 当时还没到下午 2:15。[p/]我们只短暂相遇。[p/]这时我发现，她正从阳台把什么大东西推入迦拉克隆湖。

original: Theon: I asked her what she was doing.[p/] But again,[p/] she ignored me and went towards the Prayer Room.
translation: Theon: 我问她在干什么。[p/]但她还是无视了我，[p/]转身向祷告室走去。

original: Theon: I only spent about two minutes trying to speak with her.[p/] But she ignored me and went towards the Prayer Room.[p/]
translation: Theon: 我花了大约两分钟尝试和她交谈。[p/]但她还是无视了我，[p/]转身向祷告室走去。

original: Theon: I thought nothing of it and made my way there as well.[p/] That's when the guards there turned me away.
translation: Theon: 我没多想，也向祷告室走过去。[p/]看守的卫兵把我拦下了。

original: Theon: I thought nothing of it and made my way there as well.[p/] That's when the guards there turned me away at 2:15 PM.
translation: Theon: 我没多想，也向祷告室走过去。[p/]下午 2:15 到达时，看守的卫兵把我拦下了。

original: Theon: I went back to my quarters to do my Prayers there.
translation: Theon: 我就折返回自己的房间祈祷。

original: Theon: I went back to my quarters to do my Prayers there.[p/] I was there until 3:15 PM.
translation: Theon: 我就折返回自己的房间祈祷。[p/]在那里一直等到下午 3:15。

original: Player: Overflow
Player: Objection
Eris: It's true.[p/] I was the one who masterminded this.
translation: Eris: 没错。[p/]我就是幕后主使。

original: Eris: I knew about the King's funeral at the Grand Cathedral.[p/] So I forced Beatrice Frega to allow me to accompany her.
translation: Eris: 我知道国王的葬礼在大教堂举办。[p/]就强迫比亚特丽丝·弗雷加让我和她同行。

original: Eris: When I was there,[p/] I used my Contracts with Beatrice Frega and Aria Steelwind to compel them to act against their will.
translation: Eris: 到达之后，[p/]我利用自己与比亚特丽丝·弗雷加和阿莉亚·斯蒂尔文德的契约，操控她们行动。

original: Eris: Through the actions of Beatrice Frega and Aria Steelwind,[p/] I facilitated the deaths of Lloyd von Sanctus,[p/] Coraline Sibyl,[p/] and Garrick Pierce.
translation: Eris: 通过比亚特丽丝·弗雷加和阿莉亚·斯蒂尔文德的行动，[p/]我协助杀害了洛伊德·冯·桑克图斯，[p/]卡洛琳·希比尔，[p/]加里克·皮尔斯。

original: Eris: I didn't really have a reason to kill [i]them[/i] specifically.[p/] I just needed Aria to kill my victims as quickly and efficiently as possible.
translation: Eris: 我要杀[i]他们[/i]没有特定的理由。[p/]我只需要阿莉亚尽可能高效快速地杀掉我要杀的人。

original: Eris: My only motivation for my actions that day was to harm Tyrion Cuthbert's friends and make him suffer.
translation: Eris: 我唯一的动机就是要伤害提利昂·卡斯伯特的朋友，使他痛苦。

original: Eris: And before you ask...[p/] Aside from my thralls,[p/] I was acting alone that day.[p/] I didn't follow direct [i]or[/i] indirect orders from anyone.
translation: Eris: 在你问这个之前……[p/]我那天都是独自一人行动。[p/]没有遵从任何直接[i]或[/i]间接指令。

original: Player: Overflow
Player: Objection
Celeste: The truth is that Eris rewrote your memories, Tyrion.[p/] You were actually knocked out at 1:45 PM.
translation: Celeste: 真相是厄莉斯修改了你的记忆，提利昂。[p/]你实际上在下午 1:45 昏迷。

original: Celeste: We went to the Prayer Room a lot earlier for our meeting,[p/] and that commotion we heard was actually Beatrice and Eris attacking the guards at 1:40 PM.
translation: Celeste: 我们进祷告室的时间远比会面早，[p/]听到的骚乱声其实是下午 1:40 比亚特丽丝和厄莉斯在攻击看守。

original: Celeste: They tricked me and slipped into the Prayer Room...[p/] After that,[p/] Beatrice...[p/] killed you.
translation: Celeste: 她们骗过我进了祷告室……[p/]这之后，[p/]比亚特丽丝……[p/]杀害了你。

original: Celeste: I didn't know what to do.[p/] That's when Eris told me she would resurrect you in exchange for killing Pierce.
translation: Celeste: 我不知道怎么办。[p/]这时厄莉斯跟我说，她能复活你，但我要杀掉皮尔斯。

original: Celeste: I know I shouldn't have done it.[p/] But I just wanted you back...[p/] I didn't care about what happened to me.
translation: Celeste: 我知道自己不应该这么做。[p/]但我只想让你回来……[p/]我不在乎自己会变成什么样。

original: Celeste: I didn't realize that she'd use "my eternal servitude" to take control of my body.[p/] She used me to trick Aria into signing [i]another[/i] Blood Contract.
translation: Celeste: 我没想到她会利用“永世服从”这点来操控我。[p/]她利用我骗阿莉亚签了[i]另一份[/i]血契。

original: Celeste: After that...[p/] I followed through with [i]my[/i] end of the deal.[p/] I killed Pierce so that she would bring Tyrion back.
translation: Celeste: 在这之后……[p/]我按照契约里对[i]我[/i]的要求行动。[p/]为了让提利昂复活，我杀了皮尔斯。

original: Player: Overflow
Player: Objection
Celeste: I think I remember now.[p/] We went to meet with Pierce at 1:50 PM.[p/] And we heard that commotion outside at 2:20 PM.
translation: Celeste: 现在我想起来了。[p/]我们下午 1:50 去和皮尔斯见面。[p/]下午 2:20 听到外面的骚乱。

original: Celeste: I saw Aria attacking the guards there.[p/] And I fought her for about fifteen minutes before she broke past me.
translation: Celeste: 我看见阿莉亚在攻击看守。[p/]我和她缠斗了大概 15 分钟，才被她逃走。

original: Celeste: When I followed her into the Prayer Room,[p/] I found her there with Beatrice and Eris.[p/] They knocked Aria,[p/] Tyrion,[p/] and Pierce unconscious.
translation: Celeste: 跟着她进入祷告室后，[p/]我发现比亚特丽丝和厄莉斯也在屋内。[p/]她们使阿莉亚、[p/]提利昂，[p/]还有皮尔斯失去了意识。

original: Celeste: ...I checked Tyrion's body and thought he was dead.[p/] But I realize now that Beatrice just cast [b]Feign Death[/b] on him.
translation: Celeste: ……我检查了提利昂，认为他死了。[p/]但现在想想，比亚特丽丝可能对他用了[b]假死[/b]。

original: Celeste: Anyways,[p/] Eris offered her deal to me.[p/] But I couldn't go through with killing Pierce...[p/] I think you know the rest.
translation: Celeste: 总之，[p/]厄莉斯向我提出交易。[p/]但我受不了要杀皮尔斯……[p/]你们也知道后续。

original: Celeste: A few minutes after Pierce died,[p/] Aster,[p/] the Inquisition,[p/] and the Kingsguard showed up to arrest Aria.
translation: Celeste: 皮尔斯死亡几分钟后，[p/]阿斯特、[p/]裁判所和国王卫队到场逮捕阿莉亚。
